problem.markdown:
>>Little’s Law: <<
[x] Only applies for steady-state solutions. [ ] Can be applied to obtain time-transient solutions. [ ] Does not only apply to M/M/1 systems. [x] Is often used to determine the average wait time a customer experiences in a system. [explanation] \( L = \lambda * W \), where L is the average number of customers in a system, \(\lambda\) is the average arrival rate, and W is the average wait time a customer experiences in a system. Little’s Law is only applicable for steady-state. [explanation]
